prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a slightly tapered and curved rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 1. Sketching: - Create a new face and draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.0). - Draw the second line from point (0.375, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.125). - Continue drawing lines and arcs as follows: * Line from (0.375, 0.125) to (0.75, 0.125). * Line from (0.75, 0.125) to (0.75, 0.25). * Line from (0.75, 0.25) to (0.375, 0.25). * Line from (0.375, 0.25) to (0.375, 0.375). * Line from (0.375, 0.375) to (0.0, 0.375). * Line from (0.0, 0.375) to (0.0, 0.0). 2. Scaling: - Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.75. 3. Transformation: - Keep euler angles as is, and set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 4. Extrusion: - Extrude the sketch by 0.125 units towards the normal. Part 2 Instructions Create a rectangular prism with a slightly angled front face. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of (0.375, 0.25, 0.0). 1. Sketching: - Create a new face and draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.0). - Draw the second line from point (0.375, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.125). - Continue drawing lines as follows: * Line from (0.375, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.125). * Line from (0.0, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.0). 2. Scaling: - Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.375. 3. Transformation: - Keep euler angles as is, and set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 4. Extrusion: - Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units towards the normal. Part 3 Instructions Create another rectangular prism with flat top and bottom faces. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of (0.375, 0.0, 0.0). 1. Sketching: - Create a new face and draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.0). - Draw the second line from point (0.375, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.125). - Continue drawing lines as follows: * Line from (0.375, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.125). * Line from (0.0, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.0). 2. Scaling: - Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.375. 3. Transformation: - Keep euler angles as is, and set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 4. Extrusion: - Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units towards the normal.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.125]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.125],"End Point":[0.75,0.125]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.125],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.375,0.25]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.25],"End Point":[0.375,0.375]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.375],"End Point":[0.0,0.375]},"line_8":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.375],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.125,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.375,0.25,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.125]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.125],"End Point":[0.0,0.125]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.125],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.25,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.375,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.375,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.125]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.125],"End Point":[0.0,0.125]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.125],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.25,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.375,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height, with the sloped side at a 45-degree angle. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0178, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a new face (face\\_1) in the sketch. 4. Within face\\_1, create loop\\_1 consisting of 4 lines: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2625, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.2625, 0.0], End Point [0.2625, 0.75] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.2625, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 5. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter (0.75). 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model with the following properties: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0178 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.75 * Perform a "new body" operation with the preceding CAD models. The resulting part should have the following dimensions: * length: 0.75 * width: 0.0178 * height: 0.75 The part is now complete and should resemble a rectangular prism with a sloped side.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0178,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.2625,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.2625,0.0],"End Point":[0.2625,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.2625,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0178,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Creating the Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom** **Part 1** **Creating the Base Sketch** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.5, 0.0. 2. On the x-y plane of the new coordinate system, create a sketch with the following features: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.25, 0.125], End Point [0.5, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5, 0.125], End Point [0.5, 0.0] - Line 5: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 6: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.5078] - Line 7: Start Point [0.5, 0.5078], End Point [0.25, 0.5078] - Line 8: Start Point [0.25, 0.5078], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The above steps will create a closed loop with 8 line segments on the x-y plane of the new coordinate system. **Creating the 3D Part from the Sketch** 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch scaling parameter. 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5 units towards the normal and 0 units towards the opposite direction of the normal, resulting in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The final dimensions of the part should be approximately 0.75 length units, 0.5 width units, and 0.75 height units.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.5,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.25,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.0],"End Point":[0.25,0.125]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.125],"End Point":[0.5,0.125]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.125],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.5078]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.5078],"End Point":[0.25,0.5078]},"line_8":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.5078],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2308, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in step 1. **Step 3: Draw the curves for the sketch** The sketch consists of the following curves: 1. A line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.7502, 0.0] 2. A line from point [0.7502, 0.0] to point [0.7502, 0.1154] 3. A line from point [0.7502, 0.1154] to point [0.2308, 0.1154] 4. A line from point [0.2308, 0.1154] to point [0.2308, 0.202] 5. An arc from point [0.2308, 0.202] to point [0.1356, 0.2885] with its center at point [0.1958, 0.2591] 6. A line from point [0.1356, 0.2885] to point [0.0941, 0.2885] 7. An arc from point [0.0941, 0.2885] to point [0.0, 0.2057] with its center at point [0.0354, 0.2603] 8. A line from point [0.0, 0.2057] to point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 4: Create faces from the loops** The sketch has one face, which consists of two loops: 1. Loop 1 consists of lines 1, 2, 3, 4, and arcs 5, 7. 2. Loop 2 consists of lines 6, and arc 8. **Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7502. **Step 6: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. **Step 7: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.2308 units to generate the 3D model. The height of this intermediate CAD part is 0.7502 units, the width is 0.2308 units, and the length is 0.7502 units as described in the "description" field of the JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part to construct is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3315, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. **Sketch:** The sketch contains one face (face\\_1), and this face consists of one loop (loop\\_1), which is made up of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4). * Loop\\_1: + Line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7459, 0.0] + Line\\_2: Start Point [0.7459, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5801] + Line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5801], End Point [0.0, 0.5801] + Line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5801], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Next, scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale scaling parameter, which is 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. Now, we will extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion properties: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.3315 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.75 * operation: Create a new solid body (Use the natural language description instead of the specific boolean operation term) Here, we have the dimensions of part 1: * length: 0.75 * width: 0.3315 * height: 0.75 With the provided details, construct the rectangular prism ensuring accuracy in curves, loops, and faces as these details will help the junior CAD designer create a precise CAD model.</description>
